text: Ahaa.. That’s a badly behaving muon. <https://physics.aps.org/articles/v14/47|https://physics.aps.org/articles/v14/47>

attachments.title: The Muon g–2 Anomaly Explained
attachments.text: Jorge Cham, aka, PHD Comics, illustrates the excitement over the muon anomaly results in a set of cartoons he made for Physics.
attachments.fallback: Physics: The Muon g–2 Anomaly Explained

elements.text: Ahaa.. That’s a badly behaving muon.

text: Super exciting to see what happens!! It would be cool to hear about the new physics/theories/models outside the standard model that explains it and maybe how we can find out more (if indeed there is a discrepancy). (Also thanks for sharing the article! I didn't know that the Brookhaven result was from 20 years ago)
